questions.question: Would you mind …………………………. a bit?
questions.description: We use ing forms or if-clauses after Would.

questions.question: Do you mind ………………………………. late hours?
questions.description: We use ing forms or if-clauses after Do you mind…..?

questions.question: Would you mind ……………………………. I used your computer for a minute?
questions.description: We use ing forms or if-clauses after Would you mind…..?

questions.question: Do you allow people ……………………………… in your house?
questions.description: We use an infinitive after allow + object.

questions.question: Do you allow ………………………….. in the kitchen?
questions.description: If there is no object, allow is followed by an ing form.

questions.question: The railway was a new ………………………………… of communication developed in the 19th century.
questions.description: Means can be singular or plural.

questions.question: If you don’t hurry you will ……………………………… the train.
questions.description: To express the idea of being late for something we use the word miss.

questions.question: I heard him ……………………………. the door and go out.
questions.description: The infinitive is used without to after hear.

questions.question: I suggested ……………………………… she should gain weight.
They made her ………………………………… the whole story.
questions.description: Make is followed by object + infinitive without to.

questions.question: She was made ……………………………….. the whole story.
questions.description: In passive structures make is followed by an infinitive with to.

questions.question: I begged him …………………………….. the door.
questions.description: Beg is followed by an infinitive with to.
